p.s: Following, I will comment on Walter's and the other Youngers' dreams in the context of the American dreamDream and African American history.
At first, the American dreamDream was the idea of equal rights and freedom for everybody.
But in the americanAmerican history you can find lots of racism and discrimination.
Also in the 1950s and 1960s in America was still a lot of slavery and racism.
This is also the time, when the drama plays.
So, what all dreams of the Younger family have in common is the hoping for a better life.
In this time being an African American was very tough because it was for example very hard to get a good job or have good living conditions.

The statement from Mama that Walter has almost lost his mind thinking about money all the time (task 3) is probably concerning many other Native Americans in this time too and not only Walter because nobody wants to live under bad financial conditions.
The different dreams of the Younger family all bring freedom with them, which is also one of the ideas of the American Dream.
But the American dreamDream is also about that if you work hard enough you can achieve anything you want and it does not matter which gender or skin colour etc. you have.
And this is also shown in the dreams of the Younger family because they all want to have the same chances or living conditions as for example a middle class white family.
And they think that with the paycheck this is possible.
Altogether the Youngers' dreams are all based on the American Dream and should give the family more freedom.
Also the paycheck is one of the few or probably the only solution to escape the bad financial and living conditions the family has to live with.
